intro: Matelea emmartinezii, commonly known as the Martinez's matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Matelea emmartinezii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
